data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person typically takes 0 steps backward and 0 steps forward. The length of time it takes is 9 / 3 = 2.5 seconds. So, the answer is Yes.

Before doing the third method, you had to take 4 steps, turn around, and turn right. Since there are no 4 step instructions here, the answer is no.

We are talking about walking back to the starting point at the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

Since there are seven steps in the series, the first set must begin with 7 steps in the first place where you begin. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right. Turn around. Take 5 steps. No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If a person turns around and takes 7 steps, he is on his way back to the starting point. If one turns left and takes 7 steps, he turns around and takes 5 steps. The starting point can be the point that first turns left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right twice takes 3 steps. Take 9 steps takes 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

You have 8 steps to turn around and take 6 steps to step back. You also have two steps to take to start from the next step. So, the answer is Yes.

The step in- and out- order is based on facing the forward direction. If you are facing one direction you is pointing to the left. In other words one can walk backwards in the same direction as right. So, the answer is no.

Take 9 steps and you are back to the starting point. Take 2 steps and you are back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

It is best never to face the wrong way. Take a step backward is to do the opposite of what you want to do. Taking a step backward means you are moving forward. So, the answer is No.

One has to take 3 steps left to finish the pattern. The answer: No.

Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. True or False. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you know where everything is because you always face forward. If you always face right, you know where all your things are because you always face right. The steps listed below are in reverse order from where the original directions were taken. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 4 steps, it will still take you four steps back to where you began. The instructions direct you to turn right, turn around, turn around, turn left, and take four steps back to where you began. So, the answer is yes.

If you are facing forward, the first thing you need to do is to face forward. The next instructions are to take 7 steps left. 7 steps means one step forward. 2 steps means one step right. 5 steps backward is the last instruction. The final answer: no.

If someone is facing forward and takes six steps left, they go to the right. If someone is facing forward and takes six steps right, they go to the left. So, the answer is No.
